poem:
**Echoes in the Dust**

The school—
a shell crumbled,
by distant hands.
Children, mere echoes
in the dust,
their laughter
lost to
metallic whispers.
Eyes of the world,
blindfolded by iron,
blink, then close.
In desert silence,
innocence seeks
an unmarked grave.
